conclusion: Understanding the problem with given values and relationships
Draw a free body diagram and identify all forces acting on the suitcase
Apply Newton's Second Law for horizontal direction: μN = F·cos(θ)
Apply Newton's Second Law for vertical direction: N = mg - F·sin(θ)
Substitute vertical equation into horizontal equation: μmg - μF·sin(θ) = F·cos(θ)
Differentiate with respect to θ and set derivative to zero for minimum F: tan(θ) = μ
Calculate μ using original equations with θ = 37°: μ = 0.75
Verification of tan(37°) = 0.75 and μ = 0.75 satisfies the condition
Final answer: The coefficient of friction μ = 0.75 and the angle θ = 37°
